page.title: 06CHILDREN'S SHOPPING.
page.content:
We did a questionnaire on children's pocket money and shopping habits in our school.
Most children under 9 had less than one pound for their pocket money every week. They spent their money on pads pencils, toys, rubbers, pens, books and sweets.
Children over 9 got a lot more money. The average amount in our class of 9 to 11 year olds was Â£1.65 a week. Some children had as much as Â£5 a week! They tended to buy music tapes, stationery, records and comics.
In a week younger children would spend all their money but older children had a lot left over. The children bought their goodies from shops in Chepstow or Newport.
